required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differential Diagnosis and Cause-specific Treatment During OHCA
clinical_study.official_title: Differential Diagnosis and Cause-specific Treatment During OHCA - a Prospective Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: Differential diagnosis: ultrasound, blood gas analyse combined with examination of the patient and environment is used during Out Of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (OHCA) to screen possible underlying cause of cardiac arrest. Helicopter Emergency Medical Service (HEMS) in Helsinki has unraveled a protocol for performing differential diagnosis during OHCA. Our study aim is to test the feasibility of this protocol. Our study is a prospective medical record based study. The anesthesiologist operating in the HEMS unit fills a form after encounter of OHCA. Questioners focus on how long did execution of the protocol take, and the cause if the protocol was not completed.

primary_outcome.measure: Successful execution of differential diagnosis protocol
primary_outcome.description: Successful and all-inclusive execution of the following items during cardiopulmonary resuscitation: ultrasound examination, arterial blood gas analyze, clinical examination, obtaining structured history from next of kin and searching of the environment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of cause-specific treatment during resuscitation
secondary_outcome.description: Any therapy given as a treatment of presumed reversible cause of a cardiac arrest (excluding chest-compressions, ventilation, airway management, oxygen, epinephrine, amiodarone and defibrillation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time needed to complete the differential diagnostics protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Delay from patient encountered by the prehospital critical care physician to the all diagnostics performed (during cardiopulmonary resuscitation)

study_pop.textblock: Non-traumatic out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients encountered by the helicopter emergency medical services.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-traumatic out-of-hospital cardiac arrest encountered by the helicopter emergency medical services team
Exclusion Criteria:
- return of spontaneous circulation before HEMS crew arrival
- termination of resuscitation attempt before HEMS crew arrival

responsible_party.investigator_title: docent, specialist in anesthesiology and intensive care
